com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.objects.models

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.orbischallenge.game.SidedModel<com.orbischallenge.firefly.objects.interfaces.IWorld>
      • com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.objects.models.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI, com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IUnitAccess

    public final class World
extends com.orbischallenge.game.SidedModel<com.orbischallenge.firefly.objects.interfaces.IWorld>
implements com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI, com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IUnitAccess
    Represents the game world and its current state.

    • Method Detail

      • getUnit

        public FriendlyUnit getUnit(java.lang.String uuid)
        Description copied from interface: com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IUnitAccess
        Given its uuid, returns the corresponding unit. If there are no living units with uuid, returns null. If you want to keep track of your units across turns, save their uuids somewhere in your PlayerAI instance, and use this method to retrieve them at each turn.
        Specified by:
        getUnit in interface com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IUnitAccess
        Returns:
        FriendlyUnit

      • move

        public MoveType move(FriendlyUnit unit,
                     Point position)
        Description copied from interface: com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IUnitAccess
        Moves a unit one step closer to position. Use this method to assign moves for your units. Note: This method uses getNextPointInShortestPath, which does not take into account dynamic game elements (i.e. other units or nests) that may stand in the way between the source and destination. It only takes into account walls and tiles. To include a list of "avoid" points in path-finding, use getShortestPath.
        Specified by:
        move in interface com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IUnitAccess
        Returns:
        MoveType indicating whether or not the move will result in MOVE or REST

      • getShortestPath

        public java.util.List<Point> getShortestPath(Point from,
                                             Point to,
                                             java.util.Collection<Point> avoid)
        Description copied from interface: com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI
        Returns the shortest path between from and to. If avoid is not null, the method will return the shortest path between from and to that does not visit any points in avoid. If there is no path, null is returned. Note: The path-finding algorithm may come at a cost of performance. For a quicker path look-up alternative, use getNextPointInShortestPath.
        Specified by:
        getShortestPath in interface com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI
        Parameters:
        from - source
        to - destination
        avoid - list of points to exclude from path-finding
        Returns:
        list of points representing the shortest path such that the first element in the list is the next point in the path, or null.

      • getNextPointInShortestPath

        public Point getNextPointInShortestPath(Point from,
                                        Point to)
        Description copied from interface: com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI
        Returns the next point in the shortest path between from and to, using a cache. If there is no path, returns from. Note: This method does not take into account dynamic game elements (i.e. other units or nests) that may stand in the way between the source and destination. It only takes into account walls and tiles.
        Specified by:
        getNextPointInShortestPath in interface com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI
        Parameters:
        from - source
        to - destination
        Returns:
        next point in the shortest path, or from

      • getShortestPathDistance

        public int getShortestPathDistance(Point from,
                                   Point to)
        Description copied from interface: com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI
        Returns the distance of the shortest path between from and to, using a cache. This distance takes into account only walls and not other dynamic game elements such as nests or units. If there is no path, returns 0.
        Specified by:
        getShortestPathDistance in interface com.orbischallenge.firefly.client.api.IPlayerAPI
        Returns:
        distance of the shortest path between from and to
